meanings.definition: A group of individuals who support or advocate for the institution of slavery.
meanings.sent1: The slavocrats in history fought to keep slavery legal.
meanings.sent2: The slavocrats owned plantations and enslaved people for profit.
meanings.sent3: The slavocrats at the debate argued for the return of slavery - what a strange idea!
meanings.sent4: The influence of the slavocrats in society was like a dark cloud over freedom.
meanings.sent5: The image of the slavocrats overseeing the enslaved workers is haunting.

meanings.definition: Those who hold power or influence within a society or government and promote the interests of slaveholders.
meanings.sent1: The slavocrats controlled the laws to benefit slave owners.
meanings.sent2: The slavocrats in the government protected the rights of slaveholders.
meanings.sent3: Imagine a world where the slavocrats ruled - it would be a bizarre place!
meanings.sent4: The grip of the slavocrats on society was like a heavy chain on progress.
meanings.sent5: The memory of the slavocrats pulling the strings behind the scenes is unsettling.
